text: In a democratic system _______
explanation:
Legal sovereignty shouldn't be unquestionable because in a democratic system, the powers of the legislature should be subject to necessary executive and judicial review respectively for the sake of checks and balance and accountability.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: That type of sovereignty that thrives on legitimacy is__________

options.B: vested on any form of government

explanation:
Sovereignty that thrives on legitimacy is often referred to aspopular sovereigntyorpolitical sovereignty, which means that the authority of the government is derived from the people's consent. This aligns with the idea of sovereignty beingwithin the people's mandate, as legitimacy is granted through democratic processes such as elections, referenda, and public support.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The right of a citizen to seek redress means the right to________

options.C: seek an appeal under another judgement

explanation:
Seek an appeal under another judgement is the best answer because,  ''the right to seek redress'' is a fundamental element of rule of law. It means that aggrieved parties should be afforded the opportunity to have their cases re-examined especially by a court of higher authority.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An order compelling a lower court or public corporation to perform in accordance with legitimacy is called_________
explanation:
Writ (i.e Order) of Mandamus is usually issued to mandate a public authority to perform its statutory or the functions tied to its establishment. On the alternative, the great writ means the habeas corpus writ issued to order the release of a body or person unlawfully detained or imprisoned to stand judgement
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A form of government which has its slogan to be 'ruling of the best' is__________
explanation:
Aristocracy being a rule by the Noble is believed to be a ruling of the best class of persons. Timocracy on the other hand, is believed by Aristotle to be a government strictly by property-owners with emphasis on honour and proprietary interest holdings.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Deconcentration of power means the_______

options.A: sharing of powers among tiers of government
options.B: creation of semi autonomous units to govern other parts of a state
options.C: process of setting strategies or policies for the subsidiary territories in the state by putting recognized personnel in place
options.D: act of delegating powers and authority to component units that exist in a state

explanation:
Deconcentration involves the passing down of selected administrative functions to lower levels or units within government agencies or departments with the centre remaining in control
Like the series of political office arrangements and portfolios in the Hausa/Fulani Empire i.e the Galadima, Waziri and the rest, deconcentration of power is obtainable unlike in devolution which Options B and D implicitly cover. Option A refers to the Decentralization of powers.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The concept of the independence of the judiciary means that________

options.A: The judiciary must not attempt to meddle into legislative and executive affairs
options.B: The powers of the courts can not be subjected of executive re-assessment
options.C: The sanctity of the office of the Judges and Justices must be preserved without prejudice
options.D: All means of legislative or executive influence on judicial decision making must be disabled

explanation:
Strictly speaking, independence of the judiciary isn't restricted to the idea of non-interference by the legislature or executive or either of agencies on judicial decision making but particularly ensuring that all the gateways to the activities that may put the judiciary in a vulnerable state to the other arms of government must be shut down.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The political party serves as________

options.A: A platform upon which the rights and liberties of the people can be attained
options.B: The group aggregating the interest of all in the state
options.C: A platform for rebelling against military rule

explanation: Political parties act as a means through which various interests and concerns of the people are represented and advocated for within the political system. They aggregate diverse viewpoints and channel them into actionable policies, ensuring that the voices of different groups are heard in governance.

text: A party can be said to have national outlook if________

options.A: it is ethnic based but has branches all over the state
options.B: its membership cut across ethnic boundaries
options.C: it is registered by the electoral commission as a national party
options.D: it is headed by individuals who are famous within and without the country

explanation:
Unlike the ethnic based philosophy, nature or outlook of the Action Group, Northern Peoples Congress in the First Republic, a multi-ethnic and all embracing political party is that with a Nation wide outlook
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Argumentation, negotiation and deliberation on the subject matter of a bill begins at the_______
explanation:
At the second stage or reading of a bill, the debate on the subject matter of concern of the bill begins, this process becomes heightened at the Third Stage and particularly at the Committee Stage.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A vote of no confidence means______

options.A: the same as impeachment in a presidential system
options.B: the ability of the head of state to dissolve the parliament when collective responsibility fails to hold
options.C: the act of showing disapproval to the prime minister having breached the collective responsibility doctrine
options.D: the disapproval with dismissal in effect, the ministers and its head

explanation:
vote of no confidence; a vote showing that a majority does not support the policy of a leader or governing body.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A cabinet reshuffle takes place......

options.A: only when a motion of no confidence is passed
options.C: when prorogation and collective responsibility have their way
options.D: when the shadow cabinet fails in its effectiveness

explanation:
A cabinet reshuffle takes place when dissolution is held. In parliamentary systems, a cabinet reshuffle may occur when there is a general election and the government is dissolved, leading to a need for reorganizing the cabinet with new ministers or changing existing ones. The membership of the Cabinet will be substituted or reshuffled, especially when there is the dissolution of the cabinet in its entirety in a Parliamentary/ Westminster system.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Popular political participation means________

options.A: having majority of the people partaking in politics
options.B: having a good number of voters in the electoral process
options.C: the aggregate efforts of more than half of the citizens to partake in public debate and politics
options.D: the sum total of all activities exerted by the majority with enthusiasm actively involving in all aspects of their political sphere

explanation:
The sum total of all activities exerted by the majority with enthusiasm actively involving in all aspects of their political sphere is the best answer not only because is the all-encompassing answer but also because popular political participation is the aggregation of all efforts of the citizens partaking deliberately and consciously in their governance affairs.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The area from which one or more members or representatives are elected in public offices is called the electoral ........
explanation:
Constituency is the definition for the political area from which an individual is elected into a representative office.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Citizenship by naturalization________

options.A: is the same as citizenship by marriage and registeration
options.B: refers to the process of attaining citizenship through honorary means
options.C: is the act of a non-citizen having satisfied the constitutional criteria becoming a legal member of a state
options.D: is the medium by which an alien through the judiciary receives certification and attains citizenship by birth

explanation:
Citizenship by naturalization provides the medium for non-citizens who have satisfied or fulfilled the requirements of good citizenship according to a State Law, to become Citizens.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The last measure used by the pressure groups issuing a condition to be satisfied within a stipulated time is called_______
explanation:
Pressure groups commonly issued deadlines(ultimatum) for the government to fulfill their requests and queries before embarking on strike action.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Generally, a political party with only manifestoes without fulfilment is a/an _____
explanation:
Elitist is often used as a critique label, to describe a political party definitive of social class and rankings of top profiled politicians without much agenda for social justice. Elitist parties are often seen as focusing more on presenting themselves as representatives of a particular elite or ideology rather than actively implementing their policies or fulfilling their promises.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A form of government organized by a council of military officers is called______
explanation:
A stratocracy is a form of government headed by military chiefs.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The non-stratified society in the pre-colonial era was that of the ........ where decisions were made________
explanation:
The Igbo precolonial was seen as ''headless'' and decisions were made based on popular consultations and acceptability.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The Hausa/Fulani Empire as a result of its heterogeneous population adopted_________

options.A: A unitary system where full concentration of power prevailed
options.B: A federal structure where powers were decentralized although autocratic
options.C: A quasi federal structure with devolution
options.D: A partial federal set up with deconcentration

explanation:
The hausa/fulani empire for geo-political reasons apportioned different portfolios of authorities for serve the multiplicity of functions and administrative interests. The offices of Sarkin fada, as head of palace workers, Waziri as prime minister among others are pointers in this regard.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Twelve States creation is a known achievement of the ... regime
explanation:
Yakubu Gowon created 12 states for Nigeria in 1967.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The basis of the Nigerian foreign policy thrust particularly during the Independence Constitution era was ... in nature
explanation:
Afrocentrism is the term used to describe the nature and interests of the Nigerian foreign policy targets withy preference for African neighboring States.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The Brussel conference in 1889/90 was based on______

options.A: putting an end to slave trade
options.C: furthering the decision on colonialism as previously discussed in the Berlin conference
options.D: deciding on how to penetrate Africa for economic adventurism

explanation:
The Brussel Conference unlike the Berlin Conference was targeted at the reconsideration of the unjust virtues and vices occasioned by colonialism, thereby specifically seeking to eradicate slave trade and related activities.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: According to Lewis Samuel, '________ is identified with pure conquest and unequivocal exploitation...'
explanation:
The ideology of regressive imperialism is pure economic advantage and enrichment of the imperialists devoid of any ethical consideration.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: One of the major defects of the Nigerian council which necessitated its replacement was that....

options.A: the meetings of the council were poorly attended
options.B: the council could only make law for the southern protectorate
options.C: the executive council was powerful than it

explanation:
The unrepresentative nature and figurehead stance of the Nigerian Council's membership is a stand-alone reason for the flaw of the platform. Most members were Whites who didn't understand the interests of the people they seek to govern.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: An important provision of the 1946 constitution was that it ........

options.C: introduced official majority in the legislative council for the 1st time
options.D: for the 1st time, introduced the office of the head of government at the regional level

explanation:
The Authur Richard Constitution of 1946 set the foundational road map for a full fledged federalism for Nigeria starting essentially with the Lyttleton's 1954 Constitution, and built upon thereafter.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In the all-Nigerian constitutional conference of 1950________

options.A: all official members of the legislative council participated
options.B: it was resolved that the Nigerians federation be organized on ethnic basis
options.C: it was concluded that a quasi-federal structure should be developed for colonial Nigeria
options.D: all unofficial members of the legislative council participated

explanation: TheAll-Nigerian Constitutional Conference of 1950, held inIbadan, was a significant event in Nigeria’s constitutional development. Delegates from different regions of Nigeria met to discuss the future political structure of the country. One of the key resolutions of the conference was the adoption of aquasi-federal system, which meant that Nigeria would move towards a federal system of government but with some centralized features. This decision later influenced theMacpherson Constitution of 1951, which introduced regional legislatures and a degree of autonomy for the three regions (Northern, Western, and Eastern regions).

text: Implementations of the target programmes of the government is the primary duty of the _____ a part of the _____
explanation:
The Civil Service is an integral branch of the public service which primarily functions to implement the policies of the government.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The most recent target plans and agenda of the United Nations are known as the______
explanation:
The 17 United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) are the most recent aspirational global agenda for the sake of environmental sustainability, strong governance institutions and partnerships among related others.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The federal judge under the 1963 constitution could be removed by the______
explanation:
2/3 majority support or vote of the National Assembly members was enough under the 1963 Constitution to remove a federal judge.

text: Under the 1999 constitution, the Chief Law Officer and the Supreme Court Judge respectively are the_______

options.D: Chief Registrar of the Supreme Court, Chief Justice

explanation:
The Attorney General of the Federation is the same as the Minister of Justice while the judge at the Supreme Court level is the Chief Justice.

text: Which of the following was not responsible for the coalition between A. G and N. C. N. C.?

options.C: contest for the federal election of 1964
options.D: Akintola's faction which broke out of A. G. to form UPP

explanation:
All the following options facilitated the coalition of the action Group and the National Council of the Nigerian Citizens except the The Kano Riot of 1953

text: In the 4th republic, the political parties were______
explanation:
In the4th Republic of Nigeria, which began in1999, the main political parties were:
PDP(Peoples Democratic Party)APP(All Peoples Party)AD(Alliance for Democracy)
These parties were the dominant players in the political landscape during the early years of the 4th Republic.

text: The Economic and Financials Crime Commission (EFCC) scope and nature of duty may not extend to_______

options.A: arresting suspects of cyber crime and online fraud
options.B: arresting the giver and the taker in a corruption case
options.C: conducting trials and punishing persons involved in corruption matters
options.D: investigating cases of substance and drug abuse intersecting with money laundering

explanation:
The EFCC as it is, is an executive body that must discharge its functions strictly in line with the reasons for its establishment. None of those functions extend to exercising judicial powers by punishing and conducting trials for suspects, which the strict duty of the court.

text: The Green Revolution programme was the effected manifesto of the ........ in 1979
explanation:
The National Party of Nigeria (NPN) is popularly known for its Green Revolution agricultural project in the late 1979s.

text: Nigeria's federalism is often considered a flaw along the standard test of the Classical federalism ideology labelled along with_______
explanation:
Kenneth Clinton Wheare is noted to having postulated that the fundamental, negotiable element of federalism is voluntary submission of rights by the component units in a federal set up.

explanation:
General Assembly. The UN General Assembly comprises the Heads of State and Government of all the State Parties in the UN body.

text: Executive Council of the African Union makes decision by_______

options.D: the veto of the General Secretariat

explanation:
The Council of Ministers of the State Parties of the AU, the Executive Council makes decision primarily by consensus or by 2/3 majority support.

The UN General Assembly has the duty of amending relevant provisions of the UN Charter.

text: The fact that the office of the Chairman is rotational in ECOWAS makes it a perfect example of a/an ........

A Collegiate is used to describe a rotational system of governance within a specific circle of qualified practitioners or representatives.

text: The newspaper established by Dr. Nnamdi Azikiwe to project the interest of nationalists was__________

text: The delineation of electoral constituencies for reasons of political advantage is termed___________

Gerrymandering is the process of creating political constituencies in order to favour the electoral scores of a political party.

text: A predominant feature of the Precolonial governance system was that_________

options.A: the British Indirect rule system penetrated it largely
options.B: the governance structures were largely undefined

explanation:
Throughout the precolonial era in Nigeria, the native laws of the people governed them. They were largely unwritten and enforced by distinct units set in place for those purposes.

text: In most recent times, a seemingly workable solution to the Nigerian federal question is that of_______
explanation:
Although Options A, B and C are recurring options for the Nigerian federalism, the clarion call for restructuring is louder than ever before.

text: The concept of delegated legislation is often criticised for all but one of the following reasons?

options.A: it may lead to abuse of the powers
options.B: for reasons of sheer ignorance on legislative substance and procedure
options.C: for reasons of expertise rule making on specific subject matters
options.D: it is a clear violation of the separation of powers concept

explanation:
Delegated Legislation is supported largely because certain specialist idea is needed for the purpose of rule making on areas upon which the legislature may not have sufficient knowledge and skill in. Example, the INEC is empowered to make election guidelines and regulations aside the Electoral Act and in furtherance of its duties.

text: ____ is noted for having said "man by nature is a political animal"
explanation:
According to Aristotle, every human interaction intersects with political determinations and interests.

text: The term ultra vires means_________

options.A: the exercise of supervisory functions by the judiciary
options.B: a situation where a public authority dutifully performs its functions
options.C: a situation where a public authority acts beyond the scope of its duties
options.D: the act of exercising administrative competence over a matter

explanation:
A public authority is said to have ultra vires when it has acted beyond the boundaries of its duties as provided for in its enabling law or as prescribed by the Executive.

text: Class stratification is a peculiar feature of___________
explanation:
In a capitalist system, there is a clear differentiation gap between the ruling class and the ruled or the proletarates.

A liberal political party often seeks to argue for change and transformation of the present state of things in a state including those matters of relative social and economic importance.

text: Opinion sampling may be necessary for the following reasons except________

options.A: for aggregating popular thinking and standpoint on a subject matter
options.C: to evaluate the political strength of a political party
options.D: to inspire public reasoning on population census

explanation:
To inspire public reasoning on population census is the best answer, as it is the least reason why opinion sampling mechanisms, by way of online survey or through opinion polls are organised.

options.D: introduction of the indirect rule policy

It must be stated with emphatic clarity that the annexation of Lagos as a 'Colony' in 1861 is significant to the effectuation of colonialism in Nigeria. All the other factors of economic advantage and the spread of christianity are complementary and implied reasons.

text: The Indigenat Policy is attributable to the ___
explanation:
The indigénat policy was introduced by the French colonies in various forms and degrees of severity to control and exploit the French colonial population and subject them to arbitrary punishments, forced labour and a separate court system. It was an obnoxious policy that gave French officials the right to arbitrarily arrest and imprison any African for about two yeas without trial.

text: The solidarity for self-governance system and liberty of Africans demonstrated by Africans and Non-Africans in diaspora is termed__________

Pan-Africanism is the ideology upheld by a wide majority of the advocates for the independence of African States during the colonialism era and beyond.

text: Acceleration of the independence movements in the British West African Colonies was essentially because of the________

options.A: posture of the British Governor Generals
options.C: tolerance for political participation and demonstration through political parties
options.D: speedy grant of independence in the French Colonies

The tolerance posture for the development of political parties and interest groups in the British West African Colonies spurred the pace of the drive for their autonomy.

text: The legitimate claims and entitlements available by reasons of birth and residence and/or certification, to a community of people may be abscribed as their___________
explanation:
Citizenship rights are the legal privileges and opportunities available to the citizens of a State. Examples, only citizens are eligible to contest elections and own properties in Nigeria. Fundamental rights and civil liberties are an aggregation of their individual and collective entitlements by reasons of being human.

text: A moral or legal conviction for the observance of the constitution may be described as________
explanation:
Constitutionalism is the term used to describe compliance with the provisions of the constitution.

The foreign policy thrust of a state defines its delibrate and strategic plan of actions in interaction with other states.

While declaration of war is the duty of the executive, the legislature approves or disapproves of it as embarking on war means and requires additional expenditure and budget scrutiny.

WASU was formed by Chief Ladipo Solanke among others in 1925.

options.C: Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS)

text: The process by which electorates remove elected official is called_________

text: The International Criminal Court (ICC) has its headquarters in__________
explanation:
The ICC sits at the Hagues, Netherlands. The ICC is an intergovernmental organisation and international tribunal that prosecutes individuals for crimes of genocide, crimes against humanity, war crimes, and the crime of aggression. The Hague is known as the city of peace and justice and it houses several international legal institutions, including the ICC.

text: The current Secretary-General of the United Nations is_________
explanation:
As of 2019, Antonio Guterres, a Portuguese diplomat was the ninth serving Secretary-General of the United Nations. He assumed office on January 1, 2017, succeeding Ban Ki-moon. Antonio Guterres is a Portuguese politician and diplomat who previously served as the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees from 2005 to 2015. His extensive experience in international relations and commitment to addressing global challenges have been central to his role as the Secretary-General.
